full_summary:
# Marble Campground and Kootenay Crossing Demolition – Kootenay National Park

## Tender Notice
### Reference Number
PW-23-01021194
### Amendment Number
1
### Solicitation Number
5P468-22-0194/B
### Publication Date
2023-01-12
### Closing Date and Time
2023-01-20T16:00:00

### Description
Parks Canada is seeking a qualified contractor to demolish an old staff residence at the Marble Canyon Campground and a residential housing unit at the Kootenay Crossing Warden Station within Kootenay National Park.

### Notice Type
Request for Proposal

### Procurement Method
Competitive – Open bidding

### Trade Agreements
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Regions of Opportunity
Canada

### Regions of Delivery
Alberta

### Contracting Entity
Parks Canada
### Contact Information
Aarondeep Maan
Phone: 403-585-7139
Email: aarondeep.maan@pc.gc.ca
Website: canadabuys.canada.ca

### Tender Documents
* Dongammable demolition of old staff residence and residential housing unit at Kootenay National Park
* Details and drawings available on Canadabuy’s website

### Pre-Submission Processes
* Site visit on January 16, 2023 at 10:00am (MST) at G Canyon-Marble
* Bidders must communicate with the Contracting Authority before the visit to confirm attendance
* Bidders submitting a proposal may request a meeting to clarify any questions

### Submission Information
* Email submission to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca
* Fax submission to 1-855-983-1808
* File size not to exceed 15 megabytes

### Conditions
Please note that Parks Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on procurement’s. All work is to be performed in accordance with National Park Act regulations. Late submissions will not be considered.

### Additional Information
The Government Electronic Tendering Service at www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders is the primary source for tender documents and addenda.

**Important Notes:**

* Bidders who elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.
* Contracts will be awarded based on the merits of their proposals.
* Final acceptance of the contract will be subject to review and verification.

This entry has been revised for clarity, coherence
